titlestmt.titleproper: Benjamin Franklin Papers Part 10 -- Letters to Franklin, received during his residence in France ca.1776-1785 Mss.B.F85inventory10
titlestmt.sponsor: Encoding made possible by a grant by the Gladys Kriebel Delmas Foundation

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T19:24-0400

did.unittitle: Benjamin Franklin Papers Part 10 -- Letters to Franklin, received during his residence in France
did.abstract:
This is part of the large inventory for the Benjamin Franklin Papers (Mss B F85). For complete information concerning this collection, please view the
Collection Description.

did.unittitle: Letters received during Franklin's residence in France

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Begging his influence with Comte de Buffon to procure her a pension; Mlle. Basseporte's precarious state of health renders this precaution necessary.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Accepting invitation to dine with Franklin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asking for assistance to enable him to return to his family in Canada.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requests return of his memoir on "Le Cours d'Arts and Metiers."
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Was watchman of the ship "Eliza Belle" captured by American privateers; requests Franklin to let him have the wood used for packing the cargo of said vessel.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Has received the enclosed letter (LXXIV, 97, see Vol. IV, p. 369) from Mrs. Bousie respecting the passport. Has some knowledge of Mr. Audibert, Captain of the Port of Calais, and from his letter has no doubt of Mr. Sartine's having given the passport mentioned.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Application for assistance.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Very much annoyed that their trip to Versailles did not include more of Franklin's society; begs him to make it up to her another day.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Postponing the date for a dinner to which Franklin was invited. Hopes Mme. Brillon and her family will be able to come with Franklin.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Presenting a letter of introduction from Dr. [Joseph] Priestley, with his last two publications; anxious to wait on Franklin at Passy, if his limited time permits. Urges Franklin to reunite a divided and falling empire.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requesting Dr. Franklin to send his reply to a letter from M. Dumont of Mayence.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Is a half orphan, aged eighteen; ill in bed at present; begs Franklin to come to see her; promises to excite his pity and deserves his assistance.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Kindness shown him by M. de MacMahon. Detailed account of his present unfortunate situation; begs for assistance.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: If Dr. Franklin cannot aid him in any material way, craves a few moments' audience.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asking a question or two concerning the certificates.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inquires what day he and Dr. Franklin are invited to dine at the Duc de la Val[l]ière's .
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sending a pamphlet on the science of healing.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: His present destitute condition; a Swiss by birth; taken prisoner by the English at the battle of Trenton; begs Franklin to send him back to America, where he desires to finish his days.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Served in the United States, begs Dr. Franklin for assistance.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Appeal for assistance to enable her to rejoin her husband Ignace Dumay, who is at Metz.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Was sorry to hear that Franklin has been ill. Will go to see him in a few days on her return to Passy.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inviting Franklin to come to her house with a friend of his.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Description of the country place where she is stopping. Would be happier living there always with her children and a few friends than in Paris.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: M. [Francois Philippe] Charpentier, a skilful machinist and a friend of the Abbé de St. Non will call to see Franklin about some printing presses.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Reminds Franklin of his promise to lend her one of his works in which he explains the phenomenon of water spouts. Likes serious and instructive reading.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Speaks of her sadness after Franklin's departure from her country house where he had stayed a few days. He has taken in her affections the place of her father whom she last too soon. Asks Franklin to come back again to her house with his son. [William Temple Franklin] and M. [Louis Guillaume] Le Veillard.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "A band of corsairs," mostly of the female sex, is going to make an attack on Franklin's house and larder on Wednesday morning at 10 o'clock.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Her daughter being sick, is unable to call on Franklin that morning.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: M. [Paul Jérémie] Bitaubé has been introduced to her. Asks Franklin to bring him on Wednesday evening. Does not think he needs to buy a certain secret for imitating handwriting, as he seems to have stolen it.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: M. Brillon has been unable to get a harp. Can send him a piano if it will serve his purpose.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Relating an occurrence which had taken place at a friend's house when a certain American, and an intimate friend of Franklin, had insulted a lady there present by throwing her letter on the ground and walking on it. The lady is very angry over the affair. Only Franklin can arrange the matter. Invites him to tea and asks him to bring his compatriot.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Returning a letter of Franklin's for M. [Pierre Charles] de Parseval. Nothing to correct in it.
(In French.)

bibliography.head: Bibliography
bibliography.bibref: Printed in Proc. Am. Phil. Soc., XL, 110.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sends a letter from the good Bishop of M---- who had just left for Corsica. Asks Franklin to carry out the Bishop's recommendations if possible.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asks Franklin to return her the good Bishop's letter, as she wishes to write to him.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Chides Franklin for leaving her house earlier than usual one evening, because she was engaged with some ladies. Was annoyed and angry when she learned he had left so soon.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Does not know whether she can go to see Franklin that evening. Proposes to him to take tea at M. [Louis Guillaume] Le Veillard's on his return from Paris.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asks Franklin to write to members of the French Academy whom he may know in favor of M. [Louis Guillaume] Le Veillard who is a candidate for one of the vacant seats. Sends him a list of the members entitled to vote.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asks him to come to her house at nine o'clock with his two sons.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: On the four seasons: Glycère (spring), Celimène (summer), Erigonne (autumn), and Cloris (winter). An allegorical tale in verse.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Colin and Lisette. Chanson.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sending a piece of music which she copied.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sending an engraving presented to Franklin by Abbé de St. Non.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sends twelve engravings from the Abbé de St. Non for Franklin to give to his friends in Paris and America.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sending him a new treatise on Physics which he can recommend.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Eighty-five years old and bed-ridden; lacks the bare necessities of life; applies to Franklin for assistance.
(In French.)
A. Mem. by Dr. Franklin. Doubts the truth of this story.
(In French.)

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Pierre le Cacheur, Julien Bertols, ----- Farcis, and ----- Vincent

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Reasons for their arrest.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Request passports and passage to America.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A Dutch traveller who asks for an interview with "the Patron of Liberty."

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: A Charitable Committee for the Assistance of Prisoners

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Soliciting Franklin's aid.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requesting an interview.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sending Franklin an engraving or printing machine, entrusted to his care by M. de Goué.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Ship captain of Bordeaux wishes to confer with Franklin on some American business.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Forwarding a letter to Franklin on behalf of one of her friends.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Recommends a cook to Dr. Franklin in case he needs one.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Begging Franklin to render them some assistance.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Petitions for assistance to enable him to go to America.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Has received no reply to his former request for a moment's audience; desires to speak with him on an important matter.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Called to see Dr. Franklin.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Called to see him before leaving for England but finding him occupied did not care to interrupt him, will call again.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Owing to illness is obliged to forward Franklin the letters entrusted to him by Mr. and Mrs. [Richard] Bache.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asking for a few moments' audience.
(In French.)
A. E. by Franklin. Mentioning the day and hour.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Presenting Franklin with a basket of strawberries, the fruits of his own gardening.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Statement in Bacon's Philosophical Works that the Greeks condemned to death the first physicists who presumed to explain the natural causes of thunder; applies to Franklin for aid in verifying this. Question of a belief in God; attitude of Voltaire—of Socrates.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Confined to her bed by an illness lasting six months; in great need of money; offers to sell Franklin a rare old trinket for four louis.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Recommending M. Prevost a man of much talent who desires to have an interview with him before going to America.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requesting Dr. Franklin to allow M. Gardeur to paint his portrait.
(In French.)

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Dupaty, Charles Marguerite Jean Baptiste Mercier. Paris

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Criticism of the book lent him by Franklin; begs for the loan of the other volumes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Begging Franklin's charity on behalf of his two children, both in the cradle and without bread to eat.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asking for succor for himself and his two children, abandoned by their mother.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Wishes an interview.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Regrets having missed Franklin when he called with M. Bougon; authorized by the Comte de Vergennes to speak with Franklin on an important matter.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requests Dr. Franklin to send her word about the Comtesse d'Artois, if he has received any news that day.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sends the three last volumes of the Memoirs of Baron Delott. Request Dr. Franklin to send her the day's journal.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Announcing the birth of a son.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requesting Franklin to take her in his carriage to the ball at Mme. Brillion's.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A begging letter from one who suffered in America's struggle for freedom.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: An Englishman by birth but married and settled in France, is in distress and appeals to Franklin for assistance.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A French priest; desires Franklin's influence with the King to procure him the place of Chaplain; number of savages he converted to the Roman Catholic religion, at the same time making them faithful subjects of France and America.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Appeal for assistance.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Is condemned to imprisonment for life for the larceny of a small sum of money; begs Franklin to use his influence to obtain his release.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asking him to procure his release from prison.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Presenting Franklin with a ring of his own workmanship, a sardonyx with an engraved allegorical design.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Is a poor sailor; begs for assistance to go to Bordeaux.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Is a writer and man of letters. Forced by necessity and want to discontinue a literary work he was engaged on. Appeals to Franklin for help to enable him to continue his writings.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Brusque and cruel refusal of his request for assistance; driven to importune him by his necessities.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Concerning a protested note.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Begging for aid to enable him to return to his native place in Switzerland.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requests Dr. Franklin to return a compass which was delivered in mistake for his own.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sending Franklin his reply to M. [Jean] Durival, which if approved, can be sent at once by M. de Vergennes's courier.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sending him the new proof; asks for his opinion in order that he may give the printer his instructions.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: No reply received from Versailles concerning the letter for Congress.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Relating to the bills M. [Le Ray] de Chaumont had obtained from him for the freight.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sending paper for Frankin to sign, also the two bills of M. [Le Ray] de Chaumont.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Case of an American, M. Myers, who had his trunk containing bills on Congress and valuable papers, stolen from his carriage; fears it was the work of a spy and not a thief.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thinks it necessary to go to Versailles. If Franklin can lend him his carriage would leave early in the morning.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: With reference to an error of figures in the amount of a draft presented for payment.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requesting Franklin to sign a draft.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requesting Franklin to look over the draft of a memoir which he is drawing up for him.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: He and M. Boux have arrived from Paris and wish to see Messrs. Franklin and [William] Carmichael.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: With reference to Comte de Vergennes and to a claim which he (Grand) had to certain moneys.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asking if Dr. Franklin will do them the honor to dine with them on Sunday.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Expressing his father's regret at not seeing Franklin, owing to illness. Acknowledging Franklin's interest in the birth of his child.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Has commenced the coverlet in order to make the work easier for his daughter [Mrs. Richard Bache]; sends it together with the ivory needles. Condoles with him on the inconstancy of one of his loves, who is to marry M. de Forbouay.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Date of the Abbé de Breteuil's dinner. M. Boux's affair.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sending Franklin particulars of the failure of the firm of Marlar and Stewart in London.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Returning his order relative to Mr. [John] Jay's acceptances. Asking his approbation to the list of bills sent by Messrs. Parish and Thomson.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Desiring a passport for an English lady.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Introducing Mr. Henry Jarley who is eager for an interview with Franklin.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: At his father's request sends Franklin the enclosed letter. Desires to know Franklin's determination relative to his account.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Desiring Benjamin Franklin's presence at his house to see the Procession du Bon Dieu.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asks Franklin to use his good offices in favor of a French officer.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Forwarding a letter to Dr. Franklin.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A fruit dealer at Chaillot; complains of being deprived of his custom through the ill will of Franklin's butler.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Will set out for England on Tuesday. Called to take leave of Dr. Franklin and receive his orders.
(In French.)

did.unittitle: to Benjamin Franklin and the Marquis de Lafayette.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Lives by the work of her hands; sends Franklin two vests which she begs him to purchase for four and a half louis.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Acknowledging the important service rendered her by Franklin.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Forced to quit France on business; lacks the means for travelling; begs Franklin to buy the enclosed book for three louis.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requesting him to forward a letter for her.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asks him to induce M. [Le Ray] de Chaumont to accept an invitation to dine with her.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Will call on Franklin the next Monday and take breakfast with him. Invites him to go afterwards to Surennes with some friends and dine.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Begging Franklin's assistance on behalf of a widow and two young children in his parish.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: His decision to return to America; begs Franklin to assist him in procuring convenient accommodations on a ship bound for the Continent.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sets out early in the morning for Orléans; if he should hear of any other than the present opportunity, begs to be notified.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Desiring his opinion of the reply made by her relative, M. le Chevalier de la Haullde [?] to the proposition of M. de Loyauté for a regiment.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Lines in eulogy of Benjamin Franklin.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requests Franklin to appoint a time when he can confer with him.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Accepting his invitation to dinner.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sending a letter to Dr. Franklin which she has received from Lisbon with Mr. and Mrs. D'arcy's compliments.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: His rank and address at Versailles.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Having made a tour through Spain, is returning to England, via France; desires to pay his respects and offer his services to Franklin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Accepting Dr. Franklin's invitation of dinner for himself and Abbé Strzozki, astronomer of the King of Poland.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Is a pastry cook; complains she has lost Franklin's custom through the ill-will of his butler and begs Franklin to renew it.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Is a native of Philadelphia, petitions for assistance to enable him to return to America.

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Innocent Hector de Maillart, Comte de Landreuville

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requesting an interview.
(In French.)

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: La Rochefoucauld, Louis Alexandre, duc de

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Is obliged to go to Versailles on Sunday but hopes to be free early enough to avail himself of Franklin's invitation to dinner.
(In French.)

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: La Rochefoucauld, Louis Alexandre, duc de

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Is requested by his mother to invite Franklin and his grandson to dinner. Hopes M. [Louis Guillaume] Le Veillard will come with them also.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Account of his manner of living since he left Paris; desires Franklin to forward any letters he may have received for him.
(In French. Mutilated.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Has studied for the law, but sees no prospect of advancement or gain, owing to the new regulations and restrictions imposed on young attorneys. Has thought of soliciting a position from M. de Vergennes in the Foreign Affairs Office. Thinks Franklin can help him by his influence.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sending a letter to be forwarded to Philadelphia. Plans for seeing him at Passy.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Apologizing for not seeing him oftener; promising to find the missing papers.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Writes on behalf of a merchant at Dunkirk who desires permission to name his ship after Franklin.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Desiring news of Franklin; prevented by the inclement weather from going to Passy.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sends a skilful artisan to repair Franklin's lamps.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Hears that Franklin had the gout yesterday. Sends him the books he promised, two grammars and another work on language.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sends him two petitions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Returns the English papers.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The ladies have heard that Franklin is to dine in the city; fear it would inconvenience him to go back before 5 o' clock to give them tea. Will select another day.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Saw at Versailles two beautiful ladies, Mme. Dangiviller and Mme. de Flahaut, who expressed their regrets at not having seen Franklin for a long time. They have planned to call on him and ask him to tea.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asks if he will have many guests at dinner and if he could invite the ladies who would like to dine with him before returning to Paris. Hopes his grandson will soon recover from the jaundice.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Has heard that he is suffering from a cold. Sends him a package of licorice juice drops.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asks for the loan of the Memoirs of the Academy for the year 1765.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Returns the volume of the memoirs and the Mercury of the 20th of last month; asks for the loan of yesterday's Mercury.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: His promise to give M. Arzaud a letter of introduction for London.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Introducing two Polish gentlemen who wish to invite Dr. Franklin to a dinner at which several scientists will be present.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asking Dr. Franklin if he can give him and Mme. Le Roy a place in his carriage going to Auteuil.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Returning the "Courrier de I'Europe" and offering to play him a game of chess.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inviting him to dinner and to assist at a meeting of the Academy of Sciences.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inquiring if there is any news from America and returning a volume of the Encyclopedia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Reminding Franklin that the Commissioners from the Academy [of Sciences] will call on him to-day to examine the apparatus invented by him.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sends a note containing particulars on "condensation of the air."
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Explains how Chevalier de Kerninon's name is written and pronounced.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Hopes his gout is gone and that he and his grandson will not fail to come to dine at his house.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asks Franklin to send him for translation the discourse which he is reported to have made to the King.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Desiring the address of Franklin's tailor.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Petition to Franklin for the prize-money to which his son Louis a cabin boy was entitled.
(In French.)
A. E. by Franklin. "Give this poor man six livres."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A petition for assistance in ascertaining particulars regarding an inheritance.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Is a merchant at La Tremblade; describes the productions of his district, wines, brandies, salt, etc., and offers to fill any orders sent to him.
(In French.)

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Limbourg-Hyrum-Holstein, Le Prince Comte Regnant de

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sending him a letter from M. de Weiss, whose services he recommends to Franklin.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Is sorry he cannot wait on Dr. Franklin on Sunday. Will call at the first opportunity to receive his commands for London.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Lost draft for sixty dollars; asks him to accept duplicates.

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Comte de Louitz, former Governor of San Domingo

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Called on Franklin to confer with him on different matters.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Makes inquiry about Franklin's health.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Is a surgeon dentist, in very reduced circumstances; begs Franklin to help him.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Promising to wait on him that afternoon.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Oath of allegiance.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Drinking song to Benjamin Franklin.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Desires instructions as to the binding Franklin prefers for his six volumes of Memoirs of the Academy of Sciences.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invites Franklin to dine with him and Chevalier de Chastellux. Sends a copy of a translation of Lord -----'s speech.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sends Franklin "La Nouvelle Heloise," Will call on him before noon to-day. Abbé de la Roche is going to Paris.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Regretting his inability to accept Franklin's polite invitation; asks for his pass and that of Mr. Martin Gaul.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Search warrant out for the arrest of the young negro now with Franklin; warns Franklin not to let him leave the house until the person claiming him has left Paris.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Writes on behalf of the two prisoners mentioned in the enclosed letter.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sending her best wishes on the occassion of the New Year.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A poor widow who begs him to make inquiries to find out whether her son, who went to America, is living or dead.
(Mutilated.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sends Franklin his book.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requests a quarter of an hour's audience on Friday morning about some business.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sending a composition of his own, written in Franklin's honor with the hope of amusing him.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Implores Franklin's aid on behalf of her three little children, who are in danger of dying from cold and hunger.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asking permission to wait upon Franklin that day at dinner and to bring a friend with him.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Desiring Franklin's advice as to her brother's choice of a career.
(In French.)

origination.label: creator
origination.persname: Poivre, Françoise Robin de livet. Lyons

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: She and her husband, admirers of Franklin, send him their best wishes.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A request for Franklin's patronage.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Begging for help; served the American cause with zeal; captured by the English and held a prisoner twenty-two months; lost all his money; unable to get employment.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invitation to Franklin and his grandson to dinner.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asks that the notice of the United States Government may be called to an improvement in a gun carriage made by M. Mancet, a young friend of his.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Account of her desperate situation; abandoned by her husband, deprived of her pension and in absolute want; begs for assistance.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Begging Franklin to obtain employment for him.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Desires to consult Franklin about an engraving of Gen. Washington; the affair left in his hands by the Marquis de la Fayette.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Begs for aid in her destitute condition.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A begging letter from a brother Mason.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Begging for assistance; ill, destitute and burdened with an invalid wife.
(In French. In duplicate.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Ask aid to secure a legacy left him by a relative in New York.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A begging letter from a teacher.
(In Latin.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Served in Gen. [Richard] Montgomery's army; begs Franklin for assistance to reach a seaport in France.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Applies for a passport.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Regrets that they have an engagement for Saturday at the Marquis de Biron's. Asks Franklin and his grandson to select some day in the following week.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Begs to know if M. de Montfort mentioned certain plans to the advantage of America; desires the address of the American ladies that she may interest them in her little plans.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Applies to Franklin for his share of certain prize-monies.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Is an employee of the General Control; begs Franklin to help him to obtain a position in the French West Indies.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: M. [Jean Baptiste] Le Roy has just submitted to the Academy a work which interests him greatly. Asks Franklin if he could procure him a copy.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Application made to Franklin as a brother Mason for aid in his abandoned and destitute state.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: An old man without food or shelter, begs Franklin for help.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asking his intervention with M. [Antoine Raymond Jean Gualbert Gabriel] de Sartine to secure the rank of Captain for his son Jean Bart.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Begging an audience; is without profession, fortune or hope.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sending Franklin a request from Mme. Brillon; urges him to spend Saturday with her.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Returns the writing sent him by Franklin; question of the translation.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Will not go to Versailles if Franklin has heard that the Comtesse d'Artois has received the last sacraments. M. Filleul is going and would take Franklin's letter to M. de Vergennes.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inviting him to dine at Epinay with some ladies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requesting Franklin to lend him a book entitled "Memoire sur les conducteurs."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asking Franklin what the Countess of Brionne wanted to see him (Le Veillard) about.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sending [Denis] Diderot's book "L'interpretation de la Nature" and referring to several passages in it.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: With reference to Franklin's visit to the library of St. Genevieve.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requesting Franklin to forward a letter to England.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Called to see Franklin.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Announcement of two chemical processes. The former relates to artificial production of gold, the latter to that of silver. 'Offers his discoveries for sale.
(In German.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requests Franklin's opinion of a work on the relations between England and America written by him, and which he wishes to publish.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bills and business memoranda.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Proposals for furnishing military stores, arms, ammunition, clothing, etc., to the United States.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: List of bills drawn upon [John] Adams from July 6, 1780, to January 27, 1781.
(In duplicate.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Schedule of fifty sets of bills of exchange amounting to 2,400,000 livres and of six sets for the interest at 6 per cent., amounting to 144,000.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: List of cases containing articles for Dr. Franklin, the Duke de Chaulnes, Mr. Vaughan, etc., Shipped from England to Paris via Ostend.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: List of cases containing articles for Dr. Franklin, the Duke de Chaulnes, Mr. Vaughan, etc., shipped from England to Paris via Ostend.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Notices of the meetings of the Lodge of Neuf Soeurs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letters to members of the Lodge of Neuf Soeurs, with list of Officers for 1782, 1785, 1786.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Social notes, conveying bits of news, requesting engagements, offering congratulations, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inquiries after Dr. Franklin's health, and requests and information of various kinds.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invitations to participate in Charity Meetings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Marriage notices.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invitations to breakfast, dinner, tea, concerts, to play chess, etc.
Re: Social Invitations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Replies to invitations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Visiting Cards.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tradesmen's cards.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Miscellaneous notes and addresses.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Note telling of Mme. Helétius's condition. Was very ill, suffering from high fever, cough, etc.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mme. Helvétius's illness; her condition that morning and the treatment applied.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mme. Helvétius's condition is better to-day, after having been so serious yesterday as to alarm her two friends.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "The mother" thanks Franklin and the children bless him.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Is very desirous to dine with him to-morrow, but fears weather will prevent. If his carriage comes to Paris in the morning, it might take her and the young lady with her.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inquiring if Franklin will be at home Friday evening. Count de Duprat, Abbé Palasseau and Père Caillot wish to pay him a visit.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Has just come back from the country. Very anxious to see Franklin. Asks him what day he can invite her to dinner.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Asks Franklin if the papers she is sending him are of any value and if the person to whom they belong can expect to get any money for them.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Informs him that he leaves Paris on Thursday, and will be happy to execute any commands he has for England.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The nice sayings in Franklin's letter made her more regretful at not having been able to dine with him. Hopes to receive good news today about his health.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Grateful America to to Benjamin Franklin.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A tribute to Franklin.
(In Latin.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "My surprise" —homage to Franklin—expresses surprise at having seen Franklin in pleasure resorts and applauding the dancers.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Muse of America. An ode to Dr. Franklin on the War of Independence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Advice to Dr. Franklin not to heed the homages of the fickle multitude and to show himself less.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: To Dr. Franklin recalling his planting of a tree during a reception given to him by the Comtesse d'Houdetot.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Eulogy of Marquis de la Fayette and his cruise during the war in America.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Announcing the establishment of a school for English and American girls in Paris and requesting him to recommend it.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: He dedicated his book "Texte de la Nature Rétabli" to Franklin.
(In French. In duplicate.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Concerning the fitting out of vessels.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A recipe for the mixture of nitre and antimony.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Urges Dr. Franklin to propose to Messrs. [Silas] Deane and [Arthur] Lee that red wine and brandy be exported to the Colonies in exchange for tobacco.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Key to Cipher Code.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tells where Briere, a geographical engineer, studied, and gives his qualifications.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requesting Dr. Franklin to recommend Court de Trumbinsky to people in the United States.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Requesting Franklin to give his approbation to a History of America written by him.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thinks it very essential to have the translation of this exquiste piece promptly published.
(In French.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Is not acquainted with the manner of making out memorials. Cannot say whether the enclosed one will answer the purpose. Will call on him to-morrow and confer about it.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Refusing to do business with a firm. (in England).
(In French.)
